Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for database size, performance, scalability, and redundancy. Identify the applications and services that will use the database.
Design the database architecture, including the choice of Single Server or Flexible Server deployment, storage options, and high availability configurations.
Choose the appropriate pricing tier based on performance requirements, storage needs, and budget constraints.
Create the Azure Database for MySQL instance in the Azure portal, specifying the server name, region, pricing tier, and storage settings.
Set up firewall rules to allow access to the database from specific IP addresses or Azure services.
Configure SSL encryption for secure connections to the database. Ensure that client applications are set up to use SSL.

Tasks.Task: Set Up Backup and Restore Policies
Tasks.Task Description: Configure automated backups and define restore policies to ensure data resiliency and recovery options.
Set up high availability configurations, such as zone-redundant deployments, to ensure database uptime and resiliency.
Set up monitoring and alerting using Azure Monitor to track database performance, availability, and security metrics.
Analyze and optimize database performance by configuring query performance insights and tuning indexes.
Apply security best practices such as role-based access control (RBAC), data encryption, and auditing to secure the database.
Perform thorough testing of database connectivity, including failover scenarios and application integration.
Document the database architecture, configurations, and operational procedures. Share documentation with the operations team.
Ensure the database setup meets all regulatory compliance requirements. Implement regular auditing procedures to verify compliance and security postures.
